intro: Peixotoa tomentosa f. cuneata, commonly known as the woolly peixotoa, is a rare and distinctive plant species belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest understories, where it thrives in partial to full shade. Its flowers are small and clustered, often producing a soft pink to white hue, adding to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
